problem.p: We choose the x-axis along the acceleration so we have 0 acceleration along the y-axis, as shown below:
\(\sum F_y = m a_y = 0 \Rightarrow F \cos \theta - T \sin \theta - mg = 0\)
\(\sum F_x = m a_x = \frac{m v^2}{R} = \frac{m v^2}{L \cos \theta} \Rightarrow F \sin \theta + T \cos \theta = \frac{m v^2}{L \cos \theta}\)
The tension must be greater than 0 in order for there to be circular motion:
The physical condition \(\,T \geq 0\,\) will set a restriction on \(\,\theta\):
The max value of \(\,\sin \theta\,\) is 1, so \(v_{safe} = \sqrt{Lg}\) is the minimum velocity for the tension to remain greater than 0.
